website_summaries.verdict: Easy-to-use refrigerant that is small enough to keep on hand in case of air conditioner emergencies.
pros: Comes in a handy 20 ounce can with a fitted gauge that is compatible with most vehicle air conditioning systems
Produces noticeable results when applied to AC systems that have mostly dried up their refrigerant reserve
Formulated for clean and smooth operation
cons: May require the use of some extra oil and Freon to get the best results in older vehicles

customer_reviews.title: Be careful not to overfill. The included gauge isn't enough to know.
customer_reviews.text: Too easy to overfill your system and actually cause reduced performance. My AC was still working, just not very strongly. I tried to charge the system with this and I overfilled and caused the compressor to shut off entirely. I was without AC for two days until my research determined it was overfilled and I had to bleed out almost all of what I put it.
customer_reviews.author: Will Evans

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised with a little modification...
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised and I had no issues with the directions or pressure gauge. I did not fill to the line according to the gauge fearing over pressurization of the car's AC unit after reading all the reviews. I filled the system until the AC was blowing around 50 degrees which indicated at the bottom threshold line on the gauge. This product was used on a 2013 Subaru Impreza.
customer_reviews.author: Steve, Camarillo, CA.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product Restored the AC on My 1997 Ford Expedition!
customer_reviews.text: This product brought the AC on my 1997 Ford Expedition back to life! Before that, I had just been telling someone how great the AC on my Ford Expedition had been working all these years, when it suddenly stopped blowing cold air. Luckily, I saw a TV commercial for this product, and Amazon had it at a great price, so I decided to try it. When it arrived, I followed the simple directions, and then, presto (!), the AC was blowing cold again! It has now been working great for many months, so the problem was solved without an expensive AC repairman bill. Best Regards, PG
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: ac pro works great
customer_reviews.text: ac blowing warm , compressor clutch not turning on. hooked ac pro onto lower port turned air up all the way with car running . rocked bottle back and fourth as i squeezed trigger releasing freon into port , in no time the clutch engaged and was running watched gage til i reached 34 or so . 20 oz was used up.checked air vent ice cold air worked great. 5 to 10 minute job easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: USE THIS PRODUCT BEFORE USING A STOP LEAK PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This is well engineered product and recommended. Unfortunately, I used this after using a Stop Leak product which caused a blockage in my system.
customer_reviews.author: bnw

customer_reviews.title: Magic fix for my dead A/C - Jeep
customer_reviews.text: This stuff was almost too easy, I felt like I missed a step or something. 4 months ago I plugged it in and followed the video then almost like magic the dead ass A/C unit in the Jeep all the sudden worked better than ever. The A/C has been working for 4 months now. Tried it on my buddies truck and it brought it back from the point the compressor was not even engaging anymore. I am not saying it will fix every A/C issue out there but this should be your first attempt at a repair before taking it to the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Miller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for my 2012 Volkswagen CC
customer_reviews.text: Recharged my 2012 VW CC air conditioner system using the A/C Pro ACP-100 and it couldn't of been easier. Saved $200.00 doing this myself rather than the dealership. Take your time when recharging the system and wait the recommended 10-15 seconds between fillings to get an accurate reading on your system. Also be careful to check to make sure the can is empty before taking the hose off, the canister does not reseal itself when the hose is taken off. I made the mistake thinking the can was empty and got a bunch of the oily sealant sprayed all over the garage floor. Wear those safety glasses and some gloves for precautions when using this product.
customer_reviews.author: ClimbHigh

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, easy to do, watch demonstration video first.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for me and I had no problem using it, although I watched a few different videos on youtube before actually doing it and there was different information in all of them...which was a little confusing. I went with the manufacturers video.
customer_reviews.author: TDKinDallas

customer_reviews.title: Err on side of caution when relying on gauge
customer_reviews.text: Although instructions seemed easy to follow I found the pressure gauge to be inaccurate. I filled the system (using about 1/2 can) based on the gauge indication and initially experienced cooler air. Admittedly, I was being cautious as I have read that overfilling the system has serious consequences. The following day I noticed that the air never got very cold and discovered that the pressure was lower than the reading I got the previous day. I did a second fill (about 1/2 of the remaining can), which appears to have worked.
customer_reviews.author: T. Maul

customer_reviews.title: Simple fix
customer_reviews.text: Once I determined the system was low, and not a different issue, I purchased this item. Installation was easy and within 10 minutes my air conditioner was blowing ice cold. The removable gauge is great in the event I need to add more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Shopper

customer_reviews.title: messed up my a/c
customer_reviews.text: Overpressurized my A/C, I was just topping off and it said I was low. Not every buying again
customer_reviews.author: KBasso

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Turn on engine and AC, then take a measurement with the attached hose/meter on the L port. If pressure shows low then apply the formula. Mine shows 0 so it's pretty much running out. It took about entire bottle (20oz) to increase the pressure to the normal green range. Very straight forward!
customer_reviews.author: Hot Pot Research Scientist

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: It was very simple and very effective. I used it on a 2013 WRX. The air conditioning worked, but it was weak. The starting pressure was about 40. It did not take much to get it to 50 and it would not go above 50, but the difference in cooling was large.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan M. Lang

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use and value.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and arrived to my house in time because temps were in triple digits. Read instructions a few times to make sure you get the steps right. Then double check again as any escape of freon is bad for the ozone. If container is not empty keep attached and store in cool dry place (pantry, not garage) for next use. Or return to walmart for proper disposal.
customer_reviews.author: Carlosgo949

customer_reviews.title: Warm Air? Here's Your Answer!!
customer_reviews.text: None of my cars (three of 'em) were totally deplete on this freon type ... but I had PLENTY for all three to get them to ICE COLD output! :-) Go online YouTube for your particular vehicle and HOW to refill. You DON'T want to be "Guessing"!
customer_reviews.author: dominik_12

customer_reviews.title: Simple way to check /add freon to your A/C.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, anyone can do it. The gage will tell you if you need to add any or if it is already full. If you find that your freon is full but the A/C isn't pushing out very well through the vents, check your cabin air filter. That was what fixed mine. It was very dirty and had leaves and other debris.
customer_reviews.author: Bradleigh Gray

customer_reviews.title: AMAZON finding items here is great
customer_reviews.text: Wow this PRO AC IS THE BEST MY CAR AIR CONDITIONER WASNT WORKING BLOWING 69° AFTER I USE PRO AC ITS COLD READING 48° fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly well on my 2011 Jeep Liberty. My freon pressure was almost 0 and there is enough left in the can after initially recharging it for a second application. The instructions are not too well worded and a little tricky to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Luiz

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I was told about this!
customer_reviews.text: This really is as good and easy as it sounds! It took maybe 15 minutes to recharge my A/C in my car, and that included time to read the directions. Their website has info on where to find the hookup to recharge for your car model. If your system isn't totally empty and you don't use the whole can, you can easily store the rest for the recharge for the next car. So much cheaper and quicker than a mechanic, and so easy!
customer_reviews.author: S. Warner

customer_reviews.title: Non Returnable
customer_reviews.text: Make sure this is the product you want! This item is non returnable! I did not realize you cant return this. It has safe leak in it . If you use it ,a mechanic will not flush out your Freon.
customer_reviews.author: Karie928

customer_reviews.title: Could have been REALLY bad...luckily it wasnt.
customer_reviews.text: The gauge did not work properly. Used as directed, but caused me to overfill my car. I had a buddy who owns a shop take a look at the car, and while he was there we checked this gauge vs what his 9,000 dollar machine and it wasnt even close. The actual coolant works great...but if the gauge is a piece of junk, it doesnt matter. Luckily it didnt cause damage, and my buddy fixed it for free (he got to keep all the extra coolant he pumped out)..but it easily could have. I'd stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Prashant R.

customer_reviews.title: Inspect unit before trying to use. Otherwise no returns.
customer_reviews.text: Unit arrived defective. The plastic on the nozzle that connects to AC line was cracked. Also the instrument gauge was stuck and didn’t move. I’d probably buy at a local store next time to inspect the unit prior to purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: rich

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: It worked, just like it said it would. I highly recommend you watch the YouTube video before using the product...a great help. I used this on a 2000 toy tundra, and the AC is back as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: blueghetto

customer_reviews.title: Flawless and instant freeze...
customer_reviews.text: Worked Perfectly without flawless recharged in less than 10 min used for hot environment for cars
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use, instructions were very clear. I used a full can to refill me 03 Tacoma which the air conditioning was never filled before. I'm getting icy cold air in the high ninety outside temps. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Optor

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: The pressure gauge is strange. You have to relase the pressure with the trigger after every use or you will get the wrong reading.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Stick to buying A/C Pro products locally !!  This almost got very ugly !
customer_reviews.text: The gauge included was NOT an A/C Pro gauge, but a cheap knock-off.that gave inaccurate readings during the A/C system charging. This inaccuracy lead to my system being overcharged, which could have blown the seals in my A/C compressor. Luckily, I did not run A/C until I got the vehicle to a mechanic, who with professional gauges, found the overcharged condition. I asked him to hook up the gauge that came with the kit, and he confirmed it was producing false readings. Of course, Amazon stepped up and made this right. As I first stated, stick with buying these locally. I have used locally purchased A/C Pro kits and have had amazing results with them.
customer_reviews.author: AMKA

customer_reviews.title: It worked, but gauge wasn't accurate
customer_reviews.text: Got my a/c back in business blowing out cold air again, very glad about that. Hopefully it'll stay that way. Only negative is the gauge did not seem accurate. The needle never even made it to the low end of the V reading, yet the air turned cold. I was afraid I would overcharge, so I just stopped adding any more. I've read many other reviews about the accuracy of the gauge, so I guess it should come as no surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Joe V

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I read instructions, charged my trucks weak A/C and boom! Ice cold air conditioning! I agree with other reviews that most bad reviewers didn't read or understand the instructions. Follow the instructions and it works!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have worked, although the day after I bought it I saw it at Walmart for $8 less
customer_reviews.author: Hap Hapablap

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use if you follow the instructions. Worked very good when finished.
customer_reviews.author: Iggy

customer_reviews.title: Very good A/C Charging Bottle and guage
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about adjusting the Freon level in my truck myself.So I went to Youtube to see a "How To" Video,took a few note and to the truck I went.I hooked up the hose to the charging port and with the truck idling,the dial on the A/C Pro bottle showed I had low pressure.After a few shots at a time,allowing the system to adjust,my coolant was in the (good) range.I checked the A/C in the truck and WOW,it was cooling .Many Thanks A/C PRO...
customer_reviews.author: Alice B.

customer_reviews.title: Good product and great customer support.
customer_reviews.text: Good product and great customer support. I was using this on a weekend and had some questions. I called there support not really expecting someone to answer... But I got a hold of someone and that was in the USA (not offshore)! He was knowledgeable and answered all of my questions.
customer_reviews.author: KJL

customer_reviews.title: Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting to have to spend A LOT of money on the A/C repairs in my car; and then my dad found this product for me. My A/C isn't ice cold like it would be if I went and had it worked on in a shop, obviously, but for this price, I'm not complaining one bit!

customer_reviews.title: works great, can keep the top and get cheap cans of freon from walyworld
customer_reviews.text: works as expected. have juiced up several peoples cars with this bad boy.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: AC PRO. Best product available
customer_reviews.text: A/C PRO!!! The best product for your AC. I manage 30+ Vehicles for my compand, and I have tried many other cheaper products, but nothing compares to AC Pro. Definately top of the line product. Even though it's more expensive then other products, its the only thing I use now.

customer_reviews.title: Worked Cool
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked as advertised so far. Of course, as soon as I added the coolant the weather turned beautiful, so coming months will tell. Directions were clear and accurate, and as long as you follow them everything is good. I'll buy it again if needed in next year or so because still a lot cheaper than going to the shop.

A quick reading of the instructions, and in 2 minutes I had powerful cold air blast from my '04 Jeep Sahara, which had not delivered cold air since '06. Super product, safe & easy to use.

customer_reviews.title: Follow directions and you will be great!
customer_reviews.text: Followed the directions to the "T" and it worked like a charm. There is a YouTube video that is helpful as well. It took my wife's car from blowing hot air and the compressor cycling on/off, to nice cold air. Fixed the problem for $35. Thanks:)

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy. Worked like a charm. I bought a 99 Tracker and the AC wasn't working. Charged it up using this product with the gauge. Now wait and see if it stays charged or if I need to run down a leak. This product says it will actually seal small leaks and lubricate the compressor. Here's Hoping!

customer_reviews.title: Easy fix!
customer_reviews.text: A+ product. I just finished charging my AC with this product and it took all of 8 minutes. The gauge is a little iffy but I made it work just fine. Best product out there! Get some.

customer_reviews.text: A/C Pro worked in my car (as long as there is some freon in your system) It's a cheap way to find out. My A/C is as cold as it ever was (13 yrs. old) Make sure you have some knowledge of auto A/C and how system works. One can should do it and freeze you out Hook it up right!

customer_reviews.title: Save a bundle! Make sure you read the directions.
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm. The A/C must be turned on, and compressor running! Do not make the mistake of using this product if your A/C compressor is not running, IT WILL COST YOU PLENTY TO HAVE IT CORRECTED BY A MECHANIC! A simple and fast way to save $150.00 on an a/c recharge.

customer_reviews.author: J. ACV2

customer_reviews.title: great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product really is easy as 1-2-3!! Great purchase on my part! Used one bottle for 2 cars! Lasted all summer and still going strong! You won't be dissatisfied and anyone with half a brain can do this ! Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve Monteforte

customer_reviews.title: works great.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product in the past to top up my car AC, works great.
customer_reviews.author: B. D. Norman

customer_reviews.title: better off buying a little can of refrigerant
customer_reviews.text: The effect of this product lasted for about a week. for a quarter of the price you can buy the little can of refrigerant and a hose that works a lot better than this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grwat
customer_reviews.text: Best stuff on the market when it comes to recharging your AC hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Works as described. Took about 10 minutes to charge ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Took about 10 minutes to charge. Used it on a 2006 Dodge Caravan which has known a.c. problems, so we will see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Folkerts

customer_reviews.title: Check compatibility
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to add a little cooling to my 2015 Jeep Wrangler and the snap-on fitting would not work. I called their tech support and some vehicle manufacturers went to 1234yf refrigerant and is not compatible and is a pro-A/C shop or dealer service. This product is for R-134a refrigerant systems. So, basically, if you are driving anything 2014 or newer, lift the hood and check the refrigerant label usually over the radiator or on the hood. They could expand the information, but that would impact sales.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gc

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: Got my a/c working again and in Florida, that is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This worked very well in recharging my AC. It is actually quite easy though the instructions could be a little more clear. If your refrigerant is very low, you may need more than one can, but one will definitely make it blow the air more cold.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lewis
